intro: Erythranthe × smithii, commonly known as the hybrid fireweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Erythranthe × smithii is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators.
